1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Tree structure.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Syntax.Tree
7  ( -- * Tree
8    CodeTree (..),
9    tree, trees,
10
11    -- * Transformation
12    untree, untrees,
13    treeLeaves,
14    undouble,
15    treeWrap,
16    treeLeafMap, treeBranchMap,
17  
18    -- * Bracket
19    Bracket (..),
20    GetBracketType,
21    bracketTable
22  ) where
23
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort            as B
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO               as B
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List             as B
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude          as B
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Syntax.Message   as Msg
30
31
32-- ----------------------  Tree
33
34-- | Tree of leaf and branch.
35data CodeTree p a
36    = TreeL { treeLeaf         :: a
37            } -- ^ Terminal of tree.
38    | TreeB { treeBracketType  :: p
39            , treeBracketLeaf  :: Maybe (a, a)
40            , treeBranch       :: [CodeTree p a]
41            } -- ^ Bracket-type and subtrees.
42      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
43
44instance Functor (CodeTree p) where
45    fmap = mapToAllLeaf
46
47-- | Convert a list of elements to a single tree.
48tree :: (Ord p, B.CodePtr a) => GetBracketType p a -> Bracket p -> p -> [a] -> B.Ab (CodeTree p a)
49tree bracketType zero one =
50    Right . treeWrap one B.<.> trees bracketType zero
51
52-- |  Convert a list of elements to trees.
53trees :: forall a. forall p. (Ord p, B.CodePtr a)
54      => GetBracketType p a -> Bracket p -> [a] -> B.Ab [CodeTree p a]
55trees bracketType zero xs = result where
56    result       = do (ts, _) <- loop xs zero
57                      Right ts
58    add xs2 p a  = do (ts, xs3) <- loop xs2 p
59                      Right (a : ts, xs3)
60
61    loop :: [a] -> Bracket p -> B.Ab ([CodeTree p a], [a])
62    loop [] _ = Right ([], [])
63    loop (x : xs2) p
64        | isNotBracket   px  = add xs2 p $ TreeL x
65        | isOpenBracket  px  =
66            do (trees2, cxs3) <- loop xs2 px
67               case (px, cxs3) of
68                 (BracketOpen p2, c : xs3)
69                            -> add xs3 p $ TreeB p2 (Just (x, c)) trees2
70                 _          -> ab Msg.extraOpenBracket
71        | isCloseBracket px  = Right ([], x : xs2)
72        | otherwise          = ab Msg.extraCloseBracket
73        where px  = bracketType x
74              ab  = Msg.abCode [x]
75
76
77-- ----------------------  Utility
78
79-- | Convert tree to list of tokens.
80untrees :: [CodeTree p a] -> [a]
81untrees = concatMap untree
82
83-- | Convert tree to list of tokens.
84untree :: CodeTree p a -> [a]
85untree = loop where
86    loop (TreeL x) = [x]
87    loop (TreeB _ Nothing xs) =
88        concatMap loop xs
89    loop (TreeB _ (Just (open, close)) xs) =
90        open : concatMap loop xs ++ [close]
91
92-- | Collect leaves in tree.
93treeLeaves :: CodeTree p a -> [a]
94treeLeaves (TreeB _ _ ts)  = concatMap treeLeaves ts
95treeLeaves (TreeL x)       = [x]
96
97-- | Simplify tree by removing double brackets,
98--   like @((a))@ to @(a)@.
99--
100--   >>> undouble (== 0) $ TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeL "A", TreeL "B"]]
101--   TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeL "A", TreeL "B"]
102-- 
103undouble :: O.Test p -> O.Map (CodeTree p a)
104undouble p = loop where
105    loop (TreeB n pp xs) | p n =
106        case map loop xs of
107          [x] -> x
108          xs2 -> TreeB n pp xs2
109    loop x = x
110
111-- | Wrap trees into single tree.
112treeWrap :: p -> [CodeTree p a] -> CodeTree p a
113treeWrap _   [x] = x
114treeWrap one xs  = TreeB one Nothing xs
115
116mapToAllLeaf :: (a -> b) -> CodeTree p a -> CodeTree p b
117mapToAllLeaf f = loop where
118    loop (TreeL x)                   = TreeL $ f x
119    loop (TreeB n (Nothing)     xs)  = TreeB n (Nothing)         $ map loop xs
120    loop (TreeB n (Just (x, y)) xs)  = TreeB n (Just (f x, f y)) $ map loop xs
121
122-- | Map function to all leaves.
123--   This function is similar to 'fmap',
124--   but not map to 'treeBracketLeaf'.
125treeLeafMap :: (a -> a) -> O.Map (CodeTree p a)
126treeLeafMap f = loop where
127    loop (TreeL x)        = TreeL $ f x
128    loop (TreeB p aa xs)  = TreeB p aa $ map loop xs
129
130-- | Map function to all branches.
131treeBranchMap :: (p -> Maybe (a, a) -> [CodeTree p a] -> CodeTree p a) -> O.Map (CodeTree p a)
132treeBranchMap f = loop where
133    loop (TreeL x)        = TreeL x
134    loop (TreeB p aa xs)  = f p aa $ map loop xs
135
136
137-- ----------------------  Bracket
138
139-- | Bracket type.
140data Bracket p
141    = BracketNone       -- ^ None bracket
142    | BracketOpen  p    -- ^ Open bracket
143    | BracketClose p    -- ^ Close bracket
144      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
145
146isNotBracket :: O.Test (Bracket p)
147isNotBracket (BracketNone)       = True
148isNotBracket _                   = False
149
150isOpenBracket :: O.Test (Bracket p)
151isOpenBracket (BracketOpen _)    = True
152isOpenBracket _                  = False
153
154isCloseBracket :: O.Test (Bracket p)
155isCloseBracket (BracketClose _)  = True
156isCloseBracket _                 = False
157
158
159-- ----------------------  Bracket table
160
161-- | Get a bracket type.
162type GetBracketType p a = a -> Bracket p
163
164-- | Make 'GetBracketType' functions
165--   from a type-open-close table.
166--
167--   Make bracket/type functions from @()@ and @[]@.
168--
169--   >>> let bracket n [a, b] = (n, (== a), (== b))
170--   >>> let pt = bracketTable [ bracket 1 "()", bracket 2 "[]" ]
171--
172--   Get bracket types for each chars.
173--   Types of open brackets are positive integer,
174--   and closes are negative.
175--
176--   >>> map pt "ab(cd[ef])g"
177--   [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 2, 0, 0, -2, -1, 0]
178--
179bracketTable
180    :: (Eq a)
181    => [(p, O.Test a, O.Test a)] -- ^ List of (/type/, /open/, /close/)
182    -> GetBracketType p a
183bracketTable xs = bracketType where
184    bracketTypeTable = map bracketOpen xs ++ map bracketClose xs
185    bracketOpen  (n, isOpen, _)  = (isOpen,  BracketOpen n)
186    bracketClose (n, _, isClose) = (isClose, BracketClose n)
187    bracketType a =
188        case B.lookupSatisfy a bracketTypeTable of
189          Just p  -> p
190          Nothing -> BracketNone
